thread.title: Arsene Wenger says his focus is rest of Arsenal's season not Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil contract extensions
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger says his focus is rest of Arsenal's season not Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil contract extensions

author: Jake Polden
title: Arsene Wenger says his focus is rest of Arsenal's season not Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil contract extensions
text:
Arsene Wenger says his focus is rest of Arsenal's season not Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil contract extensions Both players are under contract until the summer of 2018 but speculation over their futures is growing Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsene Wenger responds to possible Alexis Sanchez move to Chelsea Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Arsene Wenger said Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil's contract talks are currently on hold because the remainder of Arsenal's season is more important. 
The Gunners duo are both out of contract in the summer of 2018 and have both stalled on signing a new deal at the club. 
Speculation over their futures has been widespread, and many expect the pair to move away from the Emirates at the end of the season. 
Wenger was asked to comment on how contract negotiations are going with the duo, and whether the club is any closer to tying them down. Arsene Wenger is focused on the remainder of Arsenal's season (Photo: PA) 
Confirming the pair have not yet agreed to stay on, the Frenchman insisted it wasn't something to worry about, and that he is currently focused on the games ahead. 
"Once you go into the final two or three months of the season, everybody is focused on the season," said the Arsenal boss. Speculation over Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez's futures has been widespread (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty) 
"You give yourself a moment to relax. I personally believe both of them want to stay. I hope the club will find an agreement with them." 
Wenger was also asked whether the Chilean, who recently said he would like to stay in London, although didn't specify with Arsenal, could move to Chelsea. Sanchez has been linked with a move to Chelsea after saying he wants to stay in London (Photo: AFP) 
He replied: "Personally I think he [Sanchez] is happy here. We haven't extended his contract yet but I hope he will stay at the club." 
The 28-year-old is set to battle through a slight injury against Manchester City this weekend, after Wenger confirmed he recently suffered "bone bruising". Ozil is set to return for the Gunners after being out with a back injury (Photo: David Price) 
Meanwhile Ozil, who has recently been missing with a back injury, is in contention for the Gunners after playing 20 minutes for Germany in their 4-1 win over Azerbaijan. poll loading Whose contract is more important? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
